IMeshBuffer Interface Reference
[MESH+ Module]

import "meshplus.idl";

Inheritance diagram for IMeshBuffer:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

MESH+ Generic Buffer.

A generic interface, see IMeshVertexBuffer and IMeshVertexBuffer for specialisations. Covers basic functionality / information for a generic buffer. Derived interfaces may include individual functions for buffer creation/destroying. Call Open or similar function to access the buffer's raw data. Close should be always called due to possible future extensions.

Definition at line 250 of file meshplus.idl.

 Size of the buffer, i.e. number of items.

HRESULT GetDataSize ([out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Gets the effective length of the data, i.e. number of valid items in the buffer; usually set externally by the user.

HRESULT PutDataSize ([in] FWULONG)
 Puts the effective length of the data, i.e. number of valid items in the buffer;.

HRESULT GetFreeSize ([out, retval] FWULONG *)
 Length of the unused section of the buffer; FreeSize = BufSize - DataSize.

Creating and opening the buffer
These functions grant the access to the buffer's raw bytes.

Manipulating the actual data is out of the scope of responsibility of the class.

Returns:
FW_E_NOTREADY if physical buffer not allocated


HRESULT Open ([in] enum MESH_OPENMODES mode,[in] FWULONG nFirst,[in] FWULONG nSize,[out, retval] BYTE **pBytes)
 Gives access to the raw bytes; see also Close (details).

HRESULT OpenRead ([out, retval] BYTE **pBytes)
 Opens buffer to read all the available data, a short form for Open(MESH_OPEN_READ, 0, 0, pBytes);.

HRESULT OpenAppend ([out, retval] BYTE **pBytes)
 Opens buffer to append, a short form for Open(MESH_OPEN_APPEND, 0, 0, pBytes);.

HRESULT Close ([in] FWULONG nLength)
 Closes the buffer and retrieves the data bytes (details).

HRESULT BeforeRendering ()
 This function should be called by the Renderer before the rendering to perform implementation-specific operations.

HRESULT AfterRendering ()
 This function should be called by the Renderer after the rendering to perform implementation-specific operations.

Member Function Documentation

HRESULT IMeshBuffer::Open (  [in] enum MESH_OPENMODES  mode,
[in] FWULONG  nFirst,
[in] FWULONG  nSize,
[out, retval] BYTE **  pBytes
) 
 

Gives access to the raw bytes; see also Close (details).

Parameters:
mode Open Mode, see remarks below
nFirst Index of the first byte in the buffer to open, ignored in MESH_OPEN_APPEND open mode.
nSize Size of the buffer section to open, ignored in MESH_OPEN_APPEND open mode
pBytes Gets the pointer to the opened byte buffer
Remarks:
Following open modes are allowed:
  • MESH_OPEN_READ: optimised for read-only operation; any modification to the buffer bytes is highly unrecommended as the result will be undetermined; use nSize = 0 to read up to the end of existing data.
  • MESH_OPEN_APPEND: opens to write beyond the existing data. Both nFirst and nSize values are ignored. After use ensure to call Close stating how many items have been appended.
  • MESH_OPEN_MODIFY: regular opening for read/write access, ensure to call Close if any data have been modified.

HRESULT IMeshBuffer::Close (  [in] FWULONG  nLength  ) 
 

Closes the buffer and retrieves the data bytes (details).

Parameters:
nLength: extends the data pointer by nLenght positions ahead, use this parameter exclusively after opening in MESH_OPEN_APPEND mode to specify how many items have been appended.
Remarks:
Call this function each time after the buffer use, especially if any bytes were written. In some implementations however may be indispensible also after opening in read only mode. When the buffer was opened in APPEND mode, specify the number of bytes appended. In MODIFY mode you may need to use GetDataSize attribute to set the data amount.
